intro: Cyclodium calophyllum, commonly known as the goldenball tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, spherical flower heads. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy blooms. Cyclodium calophyllum thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
